solution_line_template: A pair of rabbits join each cat so there must be {num_cats} cats * {rabbits_per_cat} rabbits/cat = <<{num_cats}*{rabbits_per_cat}={total_rabbits}>>{total_rabbits} rabbits.
As {hares_per_rabbit} hares join each rabbit, there must be {total_rabbits} rabbits * {hares_per_rabbit} hares/rabbit = <<{total_rabbits}*{hares_per_rabbit}={total_hares}>>{total_hares} hares.

Counting all the animals shows there are {num_dog} dog + {num_cats} cats + {total_rabbits} rabbits + {total_hares} hares = <<{num_dog}+{num_cats}+{total_rabbits}+{total_hares}={total_animals}>>{total_animals} animals running through the field.
